class_notes:
(This course explores Black American women's writing since 1950 within national and global contexts of literary traditions, African Diasporic consciousness and cultures, and ongoing struggle for social justice. We will read and analyze writers working in arange of subjects, styles, and genresÂ¿including the short story, drama, journalism, essay, autobiography, and film. Writers include Audre Lorde, Lorraine Hansberry, Alice Childress, and Barbara Smith.)
(This class is not for Freshen students)
course_description: Course focuses on the works of 19th and 20th century black women writers. Writers vary but may include the works of Harriet Jacobs,Pauline Hopkins, Zora Neale Hurston, Toni Morrison, Alice Walker, Gloria Naylor.
